page.title: 12Arable Farming
page.content: My Dad works at North Hall Farm near Wrentham. He does the same as last year all over again. In one field, such as the apple tree field, one year peas go into it. The next year potatoes go into it. A different crop goes in each year. Then, once five years has gone past, peas go in again. A different crop goes in because the soil is just right for that crop. In July, my Dad works at Wrentham Growers'. He works the night shift. He is the boss of the night shift for harvesting peas. The pea viners go up and down the fields and when the tank is full a tractor and trailer come and take the peas to a lorry. The lorry goes to the Bird's Eye Factory where all the pods and weeds are removed. The peas are then frozen. J. Liddell
